title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Direct Energy Weapons (US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act Request: Direct Energy Weapons (US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents which pertain to direct energy weapons (DEW) being tested or used on this United States Citizen, Amy Catherine Matelic, LCSW.
For all current ongoing CIA, FBI, DOD office of the Secretary of Defense and DOD OIG, US Army Intelligence and Security Command, U.S Navy, AIr Force or Marines and U.S. Special Operations Command, Directed Energy Bio-Behavioral Research (DEBR) programs and contracts in the United States of America as of March 7, 2023 using directed energy weapons (DEWS), Non-lethal Weapons (NLW's), neurological weapons such as Remote Neural Monitoring weapons/technologies, or any other kind of Electronic Warfare or Combat Systems Testing/Training involving the use of (non-ionizing or ionizing) radiation weaponry or radiation techniques of any kind whatsoever on "Human subjects" such as myself either knowingly or unknowingly, Amy Catherine Matelic, LCSW, being conducted by any sector or joint operation of the CIA, FBI or DOD whether Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Special Command or any other, whether to determine the "human effects" or "bioeffects" of such radiation, as "scientific research" for purposes of calibration of radiation (possibly termed non lethal radiation) intended for the use on human subjects for interrogation techniques, "behavior control," "behavior modification,"  or for any other purpose to be used on Amy C. Matelic, LCSW  please provide:
1. The Statement of Work/Scope on each program or full contract with each contract awardee or winning offeror company, and the full statement of work included with each contract;
2. Completed documentation of Informed Consent from all human subjects, which may or may not include Amy C. Matelic, LCSW, targeted by this program or contracts Bio-Behavioral Research or Weapons Testing and Training Program which includes:
a. The FWA (Federal Wide Assurance) signed off by the Office of Human Research Protections, Department of Health and Human Services;
b. Detailed informed consent documents listing consent of human subjects, (which may or may not include Amy C. Matelic) specific information provided to human subjects, and signed documents from human subjects attesting to informed consent;
c. Any additional internal CIA document assuring compliance with the Common Rule-signed off by the Institutional Review Board involved;
d. All affirmations of Compliance Oversight from the Office of Human Subject Research Protections; & 
e. All waivers of consent from the Secretary of Defense, if and as applicable, and full reasons of these waivers.
3)Completed documentation with precise details on location and Field of Operations where these DIrected- Energy Weapons are being trained "wittingly" or "unwittingly" overtly or covertly on human subjects--namely, American Civilians such as Amy C. Matelic and others in the USA. All documents mentioning individuals exposed such as Amy C. Matelic , to directed-energy weapons by FBI, CIA, DOD, or any other governmental entity as listed above.
4) The frequencies (Hz) used in each DEW.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amy Catherine Matelic

title: Cryptome (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Cryptome (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Cryptome, a 501(c)(3) private foundation created in 1996 by John Young and Deborah Natsios and sponsored by Natsios-Young Architects. Cryptome is located at 251 West 89th Street, New York, NY 10024 and publicly lists its phone number as 212-873-8700. Cryptome's EIN is listed as 47-5304594. Note that on Cryptome's filing, the listed name is Cryptome Incorporated. Please include but do not limit the response to records about Cryptome's websites, Cryptome.org and Cryptome.WikiLeaks.org. Note that I am not requesting information on John Young and Deborah Natsios as individuals, their names are included to help the Bureau identify potentially responsive records about Cryptome.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: US CIC reports of May/June 1945 Linz Austria Bergkristal and Kellerbau Underground instellations (National Archives And Records Administration – Archival Or Special Access)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: US CIC reports of May/June 1945 Linz Austria Bergkristal and Kellerbau Underground instellations (National Archives And Records Administration – Archival Or Special Access)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In may 1945 the 3rd US ARMY took the Austrian City of Linz. In the outskirts of the city 2 large underground tunnel complexes were found. One labelled BERGKRISTAL and one KELLERBAU. both constructed and under command of SS General Dr. Ing. Hans Kammler (at times misspelled in the archive files) . Immediately upon liberation of these, all machinery, production and research in these were labelled, cataloged and photographed. And the tunnels were surveyed and photographed also.  Reports were made containing all this information and photographs. I request these reports with all attachments.  Some have been done my CIC and some by the Army Engineers possibly ALSOS team members. All reports were initially classified. 

Machinery and technology were removed prior to the handover to the Russian Army, I also request a report of what was taken by the US ARMY. 

Furthermore all interrogations and reports with respect to these two underground systems I request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tino Von Struckmann

communications.subject: Fwd: FOIA Request Deletion: NARA-NGC-2022-000322
communications.communication:
Dear Tino Von Struckmann,

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via the
*FOIAonline* website.
We received your request on November 22, 2021. Your request concerns World
War 2 records.

Our office uses the *FOIAonline* portal for FOIA and Privacy Act requests
for the National Archives and Records Administration's operational records
(records created by this agency).  Because your *FOIAOnline *request is for
records that may be textual archival records (records created by or
originated in a different agency but that may have been transferred to the
legal custody of NARA), we have forwarded it to our *Office of Research
Services, Textual Reference (RR2RR)* staff who handle FOIA requests for
archival records.

Since *Research Services* does not process FOIA requests through
*FOIAOnline*, we removed your request from the *FOIAOnline* website.
Textual Reference will assign you a new tracking number, and respond
directly to you. In the future, if you need to follow up with that office,
please contact them at the address below, or electronically via email
(email is preferred).

National Archives and Records Administration
Research Services, Textual Reference Branch (RR2RR)
8601 Adelphi Road, Room 2400
College Park, MD 20740

By phone: 301-837-3091
By fax: 301-837-1752
By email: archives2reference@nara.gov

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia for further information
about submitting a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website,
www.archives.gov, you can learn more about the resources we offer to the
public, and you can access our online catalog.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA has adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff. As a result of this re-prioritization of activities, you may
experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your FOIA
request.  We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your
understanding and patience.

Sincerely,

Jodi L. Foor

Deputy Freedom of Information Act Officer/Archivist

National Archives and Records Administration

Office of General Counsel

College Park, MD

301-837-2099

Jodi.Foor@nara.gov

communications.subject: Re: [22-08779] Freedom of Information Act Request - Tino Von Struckmann
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Von Struckmann:



This is in reply to your November 23, 2021, Freedom of Information Act
(FOIA) request concerning your interest in locating U.S. Army records
pertaining to “Bergkristal” and “Kellerbau” facilities located near Linz,
Austria, and SS General Hans Kammler during World War II.



Your FOIA request was received by my office on November 29, 2021 and
assigned internal tracking number *22-08779*.



The Textual Reference Archives II Branch (RR2RR) has custody of the Records
of the Adjutant General's Office, 1917- (Record Group 407) and the Records
of U.S. Army Operational, Tactical, and Support Organizations (World War II
and Thereafter) (Record Group 338).  Military unit files among these
records consist mostly of historical reports, after action reports, unit
journals, and general orders. We have searched the Headquarters, Third U.S.
Army intelligence and counterintelligence (G-2) and engineer-related
records, but we were unable to locate records pertaining to the
“Bergkristal” or “Kellerbau” facilities. We were also unable to locate
files mentioning “Hans Kammler” among these records.



Among the Records of the Army Staff (Record Group 319) are the
Investigatory Records Repository (IRR) files accessioned by the National
Archives from the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (USAINSCOM).
The IRR files are military intelligence and Counter Intelligence Corps
(CIC) files maintained by USAINSCOM and its predecessor organizations. We
searched the index of textual and digital IRR files, but we were unable to
locate files pertaining to the “Bergkristal” and “Kellerbau” facilities. We
were also unable to locate a file pertaining to “Hans Kammler” among these
records.



The Records of the Army Staff (Record Group 319) also include a series of
Reports and Messages (Entry N3 82A) which contains some ALSOS Mission
reports. A search of these records also failed to locate files pertaining
to “Bergkristal,” “Kellerbau” or “Hans Kammler.”



We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our action on this request, your options for appeal and
dispute resolution are outlined in the attachment.



Sincerely,



PAUL B. BROWN



Textual Reference Archives II Branch (RR2RR)

National Archives at College Park, MD



Attachment

records.



The Records of the Army Staff (Record Group 319) also include a series of
Reports and Messages (Entry N3 82A) which contains some ALSOS Mission
reports. A search of these records also failed to locate files pertaining
to “Bergkristal,” “Kellerbau” or “Hans Kammler.”



We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our action on this request, your options for appeal and
dispute resolution are outlined in the attachment.



Sincerely,



PAUL B. BROWN



Textual Reference Archives II Branch (RR2RR)

National Archives at College Park, MD



Attachment

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-08779
communications.communication:
Dear Paul
I am not surprised that at the first search nothing would be found as I summarize it to still be classified. 
It is quite impossibly we (the US) does not have extensive files on both General Kammler and the underground constructions of Bergkristal. 
So where are they? Its been 75 years and it is time to de-classify these files, both for Kammler's family but also for history. And being new and now in trying to obtain information from our various archives I would like to ask you how do I go about this?

I know without any doubt that the US forces took Linz and Gusen and the Bergkristal and Kellerbau tunnel systems were surrendered to US forces. It is also certain our forces and intelligence combed and documented these as well as removed what was possibly before handing these over to the Russians.  To be clear these were some of the most important German underground factories and research of the entire war. 1000 jet planes were built here and they were built and run by General Kammler who oversaw the German special projects, making his one of the most important Germans of the Reich. And in a CIC report is was stated we (the US) had him for interrogation in Gemunden in May 1945. 

So I would like to ask who would have these files? what archive? who would hold still classified CIC reports and reports on German special projects and High level POWs? The CIA? Langley? the FBI - I  know we have them I just dont know who to ask or where to look. 

Certainly after all these years they should be declassified as so many others but how do we go about this.

I really appreciate any help and searches you can assist me with

thank you

SSG Tino Struckmann

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-08779
communications.communication:
Dear Paul

Perhaps this helps, the Bergkristall tunnel system had the following code names 
B8
Georgenmuhle
EscheII
St. Georgen Bergkristall
And they were constructed by Architect Karl Emil Fiebinger 

I do have a few photos that have been released and the overview of the tunnel system from the Architects office if that helps? these of course further proves the reports and documentation was made. 

The tunnels were taken on May1 by the 11th Armored Division of the 3Army possibly combat command B

I hope some of that helps.

Thank you

SSG

communications.subject: Re: [22-18467] Freedom of Information Act Request - Tino Von Struckmann
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Von Struckmann:



This is in reply to your November 23, 2021, Freedom of Information Act
(FOIA) request concerning your interest in locating records pertaining to
“B8,” “Georgenmuhle,” “EscheII,” “St. Georgen Bergkristall,” and Karl Emil
Fiebinger.” You also mentioned that you believe that the “11th Armored
Division of the [Third] Army, possibly [C]ombat [C]ommand B,” was involved
in the capture of the various tunnels housing German equipment that were
part of the special weapons program directed by General Hans Kammler.



Your FOIA request was received by my office on January 27, 2022 and
assigned internal tracking number *22-18467*.



It would appear that, with the exception of your request for information on
records concerning Karl Emil Fiebinger, research pertaining to all of the
abovementioned subjects was recently carried out by a member of our staff,
Lauren Theodore, and reported to you on February 7, 2022 (see our response
22-17799). As our office has a relatively small staff and deals with a
significant number of FOIA requests on a weekly basis, we would appreciate
it if you would refrain from sending duplicate FOIA requests in future.



Among the Records of the Army Staff (Record Group 319) are the
Investigatory Records Repository (IRR) files accessioned by the National
Archives from the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (USAINSCOM).
The IRR files are military intelligence and Counter Intelligence Corps
(CIC) files maintained by USAINSCOM and its predecessor organizations. We
searched the index of textual and digital IRR files and located two files
pertaining to Karl Fiebinger (but *not* Karl Emil Fiebinger). These
files (*XE061504
and D061504*) are *digital* IRR files. However, since these files need to
be reviewed for categories of information exempted from disclosure under
the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), we are transferring your request to
the Special Access and FOIA staff for further action. The Special Access
and FOIA staff will be in contact about the status of your request.



We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our action on this request, your options for appeal and
dispute resolution are outlined in the attachment.



Sincerely,



PAUL B. BROWN



Textual Reference Archives II Branch (RR2RR)

National Archives at College Park, MD



Attachment

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request #RD 66830
communications.communication:
Dear Tino Von Struckmann:

I am writing in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request
received by this office on February 14, 2022 for records in the custody of
the National Archives and Records Administration. Your request was assigned
FOIA Tracking Number *RD 66830*.

Unfortunately, the COVID-19 pandemic has created many unprecedented
challenges in our work. The majority of the records that our customers
request require our staff to be on-site to search for and review microfilm,
microfiche, or original textual records. Even as we expand our reopening,
operations may be temporarily curtailed due to limited staffing and/or
deteriorating local health conditions.

Due to limitations on staff in our facility over the course of the
pandemic, the backlog of FOIA requests has significantly expanded, and we
are continuing to work on logging in and providing initial responses to the
FOIA requests we received over the past 24 months.

Currently, a search is being conducted for your requested file. Once the
search is complete, we will provide you with a more substantive response
detailing the results of the search and the estimated completion date for
the review of the record(s) as required under FOIA.

Our small staff has and will continue to work diligently to process each
request as quickly as possible, but given how rapidly the situation can
change due to the pandemic, we are not yet able to offer an estimated
timeframe for when staff will reach your request.

*Please note, we will not respond to requests for status updates more than
once every six months. *

Sincerely,

Ashney Randle
Government Information Specialist
Special Access & FOIA Program (RF)
National Archives at College Park

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #RD 66830
communications.communication:
I can elaborate on my request, 
I know as American forces took the tunnel systems in St. Georgen, Gusen (Bergkristall and Kellerbau) the Air force photographed these tunnels and the several thousands of pieces of machinery, Also the technical branch and OSS made extensive reports in May and June 1945. Furthermore US Forces removed as many machines as was possibly before the hand over to the Russian army in August 1945. 
Furthermore Both British and US air forces flew reconnaissance flights and photographed these tunnels and reported on these with photos attached in both 44 and 45. This report was released but the photos and aerial photos from before and after liberation have not been released.  
These two tunnel systems were extensively documented, photographed and catalogued. Please help me find these photos these were the most technically advanced underground production facilities the Germans built during the war. 
Today very few prisoners are still alive and they would like to show the world what their friends there died for, so time is of the essence 
I hope this helps

title: Washington Department of Corrections FOIA Logs - 2012 - 2016

communications.subject: Public Records Request: Washington Department of Corrections FOIA Logs - 2012 - 2016
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to RCW Ch. 42.56 (Public Records Act), I hereby request the following records:

Logs of all FOIA / Public Document / Record Requests requests made from Jan. 1, 2012 through the date of this request.

Please provide responsive documents in their native format with metadata. For example, if available, a spreadsheet or plaintext file is preferred over scanned photocopies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Bernard Rodriguez

Bernard Rodriguez

Mr. Rodriguez:

This letter is a follow up to my previous correspondence to you dated May 3, 2016 regarding your public disclosure request, tracking #PDU-41988.

You wrote to request disclosure of the following records:

*       Logs of all Public Record Requests in their native format to include metadata with the timeframe of January 1, 2012 - April 26, 2016; the date your request was received

My interpretation of your request is as follows:

*       Logs of all Public Record Requests to include; Public Disclosure log #, last name, first name, DOC # (if applicable), date of receipt, assigned to, date of last action and requested items, in their native format to include metadata with the timeframe of January 1, 2012 - April 26, 2016; the date your request was received.

If my interpretation is incorrect, please let me know.

Per RCW 42.56.070(9) and the recent State of Washington court of appeals decision in SEIU 775NW v. DSHS and Freedom Foundation, in situations where the Department has some indication that a list might be used for commercial purposes, it has an obligation to ensure requests are not seeking lists for commercial purposes.  As such, I am requesting that you state the purpose of your request.

I will wait to hear from you before proceeding further.  If I do not hear from you within 30 days, your request will be administratively closed.

Sincerely,

Sarah Deede, Public Disclosure Specialist

Bernard Rodriguez

Mr. Rodriguez:

I am in receipt of your email regarding your public disclosure request, tracking #PDU-41988. You wanted to follow up and inquire about when you can expect to receive a response.

In my correspondence dated May 12, 2016 and May 19, 2016 I stated that Per RCW 42.56.070(9) and the recent State of Washington court of appeals decision in SEIU 775NW v. DSHS and Freedom Foundation, in situations where the Department has some indication that a list might be used for commercial purposes, it has an obligation to ensure requests are not seeking lists for commercial purposes. As such, I am requesting that you state the purpose of your request.

To date, we have not received a response from you. I will wait to hear from you before proceeding further. If I do not hear from you within 30 days, your request will be administratively closed.

Sincerely,

Sarah Deede, Public Disclosure Specialist
Public Disclosure Unit
Department of Corrections
P.O. Box 41118
Olympia, WA  98504-1118

SD: PDU-41988



The Washington Department of Corrections is increasing the security level for email messages containing confidential or restricted data. A new Secure Email Portal is being implemented. Outbound email messages from DOC staff that contain confidential or restricted data will be routed to the portal. A notification of the secured message will be delivered to the recipient.

Click on the following web link for more information.
http://www.doc.wa.gov/business/secureemail.asp

communications.subject: RE: Public Records Request #PDU-41988
communications.communication:
Ms. Deede,  

I apologize about the delay, I am using an automated service to submit this request. 

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.  The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and, once more,  not for commercial usage.

Please update on the status of this request.

Thank you for time and I appreciate your efforts in fulfilling this request.

--Bernard Rodriguez

title: Police Staff Roster (March 2023) (Richland Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (March 2023) (Richland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Police Public Records Request :: P012344-030923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Re: Public Records Request No. P012344-030923 - Acknowledgment / Request Complete 

Dear Ms. Terse, 

This email serves as acknowledgment, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, of your public records request received March 9, 2023. 

This request has been assigned tracking number P012344-030923. Please reference this number in any future correspondence concerning this request. 

Records responsive to your request are now available. To retrieve these records, please sign in to the City of Richland Public Records Request Portal ("My Records Center"), select "View My Requests" then select "View File(s)." 

Please note that records may not be accessible from certain mobile devices. If you are unable to access the records provided, please access your Public Records Portal account from another device. 

If you are aware of any records you expected to receive but have not, please contact us immediately by responding to this email. 

We consider this request complete. No additional action will be taken related to this request. 

Respectfully, 

Toni Fulton 
Public Records Officer

title: Police Dispatches from Shotspotter Alerts + 911 Calls (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Dispatches from Shotspotter Alerts + 911 Calls (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All police dispatches due to Shotspotter alerts. Information should include the identifying ID to match with the Shotspotter alert, date/time received, description (if applicable), district/beat,  and unit(s) dispatched. 
2. All 911 calls  to the police department of interest.

Please provide me with these public records in a machine-readable ASCII format, such as a CSV, SQL, TXT, or similar raw file. CSV or SQL files are preferred when available. Please email the responsive records to my email address: michaeltopper@ucsb.edu.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Topper

title: Boise State University: "No Public Funds for Abortion Act" guidance

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Boise State University: "No Public Funds for Abortion Act" guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policies concerning the "No Public Funds for Abortion Act" (Idaho Code §§ 18-8701, et seq.) or its provisions, or guidance distributed to faculty, staff, or students concerning the same. This request is limited to records generated on or after February 19, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Open Records Request_MuckRock_02282023
communications.communication:
Date 2/28/2023



Dear Adam Steinbaugh:



The University is in receipt of your request for records pertaining to any
policies concerning the "No Public Funds for Abortion Act" (Idaho Code §§
18-8701, et seq.) or its provisions, or guidance distributed to faculty,
staff, or students concerning the same. A longer period of time is needed
to locate, retrieve, and review the request for records. Pursuant to Idaho
Code §74-102, the University will respond to the request for records no
later than 10 working days from today, by March 14, 2023.



Sincerely,

Mike Sharp

Open Records Custodian

-

Boise State University

1910 University Drive

Boise, Idaho 83725-1055

(208) 426-1597



*Name*
  Adam Steinbaugh
*Business Name*
  Muckrock News
*Address*
  263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
United States
Map It
<http://maps.google.com/maps?q=263+Huntington+Ave+Boston%2C+MA+02115+United+States>
*Daytime Phone Number*
  (208) 695-1092
*Email*
  134413-31324562@requests.muckrock.com
*I wish to examine and/or copy the following public records:*
  To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following
records:

Any policies concerning the "No Public Funds for Abortion Act" (Idaho Code
§§ 18-8701, et seq.) or its provisions, or guidance distributed to faculty,
staff, or students concerning the same. This request is limited to records
generated on or after February 19, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform
me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer
the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or
CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I
look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business
days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
*By checking the box and submitting the form you understand and agree to
the terms below.*


   - I understand that if the response to my request contains more than 100
   pages, pursuant to Idaho Code § 74-102(10)(b)(i) I can be charged $0.10 per
   page. I understand that if the response to my request includes records from
   which nonpublic information must be deleted, then pursuant to Idaho Code §
   74-102(10)(b)(ii), I can be charged for the actual labor cost associated
   with redacting the nonpublic information from the records. I understand
   that if the actual labor associated with locating and copying documents for
   my request will exceed two (2) person hours, then pursuant to Idaho Code §
   74-102(10)(b)(iii), I can be charged for that labor cost.

MIKE SHARP
Director of Media Relations

Boise State University

Phone: (208) 426-1597
Email: mikesharp@boisestate.edu

Mail: 1910 University Drive, Boise, ID 83725-1030
Location: 1173 University Drive, Boise, ID 83706
Web: giving.boisestate.edu  |  alumni.boisestate.edu

Make a gift to Boise State today! <https://give.boisestate.edu/>

title: FOIA Request

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All agency contracts, licenses, MOUs, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with IDEMIA North America.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

The West Virginia State Police is in receipt of your request for documents related to IDEMIA North America.  One document related to your request was located, please find attached Purchase Order and Agreement between the West Virginia State Police and Idemia Identity & Security USA for Multi-Biometric Solution (MBIS).

Pursuant to West Virginia Code § 29B-1-3 et seq., the responsibility of the custodian of any public records or public body to produce the requested records for documents is at an end.

Sincerely,

Mendi Craddock
Paralegal

West Virginia State Police
725 Jefferson Road
South Charleston, WV 25309
Telephone: 304-746-2113
Fax: 304-746-2421

    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAj2FudzmRZwdAiERgry6toE2k%3A1hB9cE%3AF-ynOEC8wloMEmLSIUlU6gGNC4g&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Femail%3Dfoipaquestions%2540ic.fbi.gov%26next%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252F62-88217-71203%252F#agency-reply

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Jack Gilbert Graham

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jack Gilbert Graham
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning John "Jack" Gilbert Graham (January 23, 1932 – January 11, 1957), an American mass murderer, who on November 1, 1955, killed 44 people aboard United Airlines Flight 629 near Longmont, Colorado using a dynamite time bomb. Graham. The FBI described Jack Gilbert Graham as one of its major cases.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

    1957), an American mass murderer, who on November 1, 1955, killed 44 people
    aboard United Airlines Flight 629 near Longmont, Colorado using a dynamite
    time bomb. Graham. The FBI described Jack Gilbert Graham as one of its major
    cases.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/65492/FBI20fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/65492/Jack20Gilbert20Graham20E2809420FBI.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/agency_login/federal-bureau-of-investigation-10/jack-gilbert-graham-66509/?email=foipaquestions%40ic.fbi.gov&uuid-login=a221aa0c-1a04-4dec-8447-c923beb51971#agency-reply

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Police Staff Roster (March 2023) (Poulsbo Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (March 2023) (Poulsbo Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-134 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Poulsbo ************************************************************************ Your first Poulsbo record request (request number #23-134) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Within five business days, the City will either: (1) provide the record(s), (2) provide an internet address and link on the city’s web site to the specific records requested, (3) acknowledge receipt of the request and provide a reasonable estimate of the time the city will require to respond to the request, (4) if the request is unclear, acknowledge the request and ask the requestor to clarify the request and provide, to the greatest extent possible, a reasonable estimate of the time the city will require to respond to the request if it is not clarified, or (5) deny the request. All communications will come through the City's web portal. Sincerely, Rhiannon Fernandez, CMC, CPROPublic Records Officer Kelly ZiemannPolice Public Records Officer As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Poulsbo Public Records portal here. If you haven't already activated your account, click here to get started. Once your account is activated, your request will be visible at the following link: Request #23-134. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Poulsbo.
